RAB-0009_syn_8: We performed a robotic bronchoscopy on a 52-year-old female with a lingular nodule using the Monarch platform. Navigation led us to a subpleural location where radial EBUS showed an adjacent 10 mm lesion. Augmented fluoroscopy confirmed the position. We took four biopsies with no complications.

RAB-0009: PATIENT: [REDACTED] 09, 52-year-old female. MRN: [REDACTED]. INDICATION FOR OPERATION: 52-year-old never smoker with a 1.0 cm lingular pulmonary nodule, noncalcified and mildly FDG-avid, referred for Monarch robotic biopsy. PREOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Lingular pulmonary nodule. POSTOPERATIVE DIAGNOSIS: Same. PROCEDURE: Robotic navigational bronchoscopy using Monarch platform (CPT 31627), radial EBUS (CPT 31654), transbronchial lung biopsy (CPT 31628). With the patient under general anesthesia and ETT, CT-based plan was loaded and airway registration completed. The robotic catheter and sheath were advanced along the planned path to the lingular segment. Radial EBUS demonstrated an adjacent 10 mm lesion immediately subpleural. Augmented fluoroscopy without CBCT was used to refine position, confirming tool-in-lesion. Four forceps biopsies were obtained with minimal bleeding. No brushing or BAL was performed. The patient tolerated the procedure well and was discharged after routine recovery.
